page.title: 15LAW AND ORDER
page.content: {LAW AND ORDER The firemen at Newcastleton train once a week on Thursday nights for two hours.The{fire brigade}usually get there water from ponds,rivers and hydrens.Newcastleton firemen cover from Hermitage,Hawick road,Dumfries Border.They have one fire engine.If the firemen run out of water they see if there is a pond or river near but if not they call for another six fire engines to{ferry}back and forward for the water.They usually have about twenty (max) fires in a year.The most serious fires were house fires.At Hermitage and Stelsaw lodge.They have ten people in there unit.The room next to the fire engine has a{Radio Scan and every fireman has a bleeper.At the side of the engine are tallys with names and time to be back by.Last week there was a fire at Penton.
